results.source:
Test and Deploy with Confidence

Easily sync your projects with Travis CI
and you’ll be testing your code in minutes!

{{#if this.auth.signedOut}} {{#if this.multiVcs.disabled}} {{/if}} {{#if this.multiVcs.enabled}}
{{#if this.multiVcs.enableAssemblaLogin}} {{/if}} {{#if this.multiVcs.enableBitbucketLogin}} {{/if}}
{{/if}} {{/if}} {{#if this.auth.signingIn}} {{/if}}

The home of
open source testing

Over 900k open source projects
and 600k users are testing on Travis CI.

Travis CI is trusted by great companies

Testing your open source
projects will always be free!

Seriously. Always. We like to think of it as our way of giving
back to a community that connects so many people.

Features to help you get the job done

  • Get set up in seconds

    Login with GitHub, tell Travis CI to test a project, and then push to GitHub. Could it be any simpler!

  • Supports your platform

    Many databases and services are pre-installed and can be enabled in your build configuration.

  • Test your pull requests

    Make sure every Pull Request to your project is tested before it's merged.

  • Deploy anywhere

    Updating staging or production as soon as your tests pass has never been easier!

  • Quick setup
  • Live build views
  • Pull request support
  • Pre-installed database services
  • Auto deployments on passing builds
  • Clean VMs for every build
  • Mac, Linux, and iOS support

Branch build flow

You push your
code to GitHub

GitHub triggers
Travis CI to build

Hooray!
Your build passes!

Travis CI deploys
to Heroku

Travis CI tells your
team all is well

Pull request build flow

A pull request
is created

GitHub tells Travis CI
the build is mergeable

Hooray!
Your build passes!

Travis CI updates
the PR that it passed

You merge in
the PR goodness

People have said nice things about us.

Travis CI makes it so much easier for us to coordinate the thousands of commits and contributors that flow through the Rails code base. The test suite for such a large project is vast, and we wouldn't be catching issues as quickly or smoothly without the help of Travis.

David Heinemeier Hansson

Creator of Ruby on Rails

dhh

We love Travis CI at @TwitterOSS and we use it for the majority of our open source projects on GitHub. Travis CI is simple to use, we love their API to build tooling and adore the new container infrastructure for speedier builds.

Chris Aniszczyk

Former Head of Open Source at Twitter

cra

Not only is Travis CI the best way to test your software, it is the right way. rm -rf jenkins&&touch .travis.yml

Alex Gaynor

PyPy and Python Core Team Member

alex

results.source:
First time here? Let's get you started!

  1. Activate your GitHub repositories

    Once you're signed in, go to your profile page where you'll see all the organizations you're a member of.

    You can install the GitHub App integration by clicking the Activate button for each organization you would like to use with Travis CI.

    Please note: You need to be an admin for any repositories you want to setup on Travis CI.

  2. Add a .travis.yml file to your repository

    In order for Travis CI to build your project, you'll need to add a .travis.yml configuration file to the root directory of your repository.

    If a .travis.yml is not in your repository, or is not valid YAML, Travis CI will ignore it.

    Here you can find some of our basic language examples .

  3. Trigger your first build

    You've configured the GitHub App integration, and added a .travis.yml file to your repository, all you need to do now is commit it to your local git history and git push it to GitHub!

That's pretty much it!

Want to read more? Head to our docs .

This can happen for different reasons, most commonly due to an older token stored on our end, or because some of the permissions have been removed from the token. Unfortunately we need those to provide you with the best service.

Luckily, the issue can be easily corrected by going through the login flow once again. Make sure the permissions we ask for are all available.

For more information about the OAuth scopes and what we need them for, check our documentation on this topic .

So, you wanna use our logo?

That's no problem at all!
But first, let's go over some basics on how to use it.

The Travis CI wordmark combines the Travis CI mascot with the words “Travis CI” with a specific font and spacing treatment, creating a recognizable logo. This logo or wordmark is used online and in print for product website, sponsored conference materials, invoices, emails, and other official business uses. You may also use the wordmark in other materials such as presentations mentioning Travis CI, conferences we are sponsoring and other partnerships.

Approved official Travis CI logos are available to download in high and low res (.eps, .png) below. If you have questions about using our logo, please email support@travis-ci.com .

Typography

  • Source Sans Pro

    Light (300)

  • Source Sans Pro

    Regular (400)

  • Source Sans Pro

    Semi Bold (600)

Brand Colors

  • Oxide blue #3EAAAF

  • Turf green #39AA56

  • Canary yellow #EDDE3F

  • Brick red #DB4545

  • Asphalt grey #666666

Alternative mascots for use

There are a couple alternative options for Travis CI's logo usage . If you would like to use a simplified version of our logo or a version for various background colors, please select from the following options. If you have questions about using our logo, please email support@travis-ci.com .

Go ahead! Do these things:

  • Use the Travis CI logo to link back to travis-ci.com
  • Use the logo to show you're running your tests on Travis CI
  • Use the mascot or logo in your blog, presentation or print material when mentioning us
  • Use mascot or logo to show that your application or product integrates with Travis CI
  • Use the mascot or logo for your next tattoo design (please, send us pics!)
  • Use the mascot or logo to create vegan cookie shapes and send c/o @ctrlaltjustine to Berlin

Please don't do these things:

  • Alter the logo in any way
  • Redesign, redraw, animate, modify, distort or alter the proportions, color or typeface of the logo
  • Use the logo for your own company or application icon
  • Naming your projects in a way that implies Travis CI's endorsement
  • Use the logo in artwork for sale
  • Use the Travis CI artwork without permission

You will receive unlimited builds and 3 concurrent jobs for free, along with all the other features you've come to love from Travis CI. Set up your open source project now {{#if this.scrollToContact}}{{/if}} {{!-- Contact form section --}} Looking for something custom or on-prem? We can create a plan that's customized to your team's size and needs. Just use this form to contact us! {{!-- Enterprise section --}} Travis CI Enterprise Our on-premises product is perfect for companies who want to keep using the same features of Travis CI with additional on-site security needs. Learn more about Travis CI Enterprise {{!-- FAQ Section --}} Frequently asked questions {{!-- FAQ set 1 --}} What is a concurrent job? Every commit triggers a build composed of a single job by default. If two commits have been pushed while on the Startup plan (2 concurrent jobs), they'll be run right away. Subsequent commits have to wait until the builds finished. Are there any restrictions on build time? A build has 120 minutes to run. Should your build take longer, you can split it up using a build matrix. {{!-- FAQ set 2 --}} Can I pay annually? You most certainly can! And you get 1 month for free — 12 months for the price of 11! Simply select the annual option when signing up for a subscription, or go to {{format-domain billingUrl}} if you want to switch your current plan to annual. Can I cancel anytime? Absolutely! You can manage your account on your billing page. Go to {{format-domain billingUrl}} and choose the account you want to cancel. {{!-- FAQ set 3 --}} Am I able to upgrade my plan? Yes! We have many plans available for your concurrency needs. You can change your plan subscription at any time on the billing page or contact us if you’re looking for something custom. Do the listed prices include VAT? Prices listed are excluding VAT, which will be added depending on origin (Germany and Europe). Make sure to have your company's VAT ID ready when entering billing details to remove VAT! {{!-- FAQ set 4 --}} How does the trial work? Your free trial includes 100 builds and starts as soon as you set up your first project and push a commit. The trial is limited to two concurrent jobs. Do you have plans for students? We most certainly do! You can find all details on {{format-domain config.urls.education}} {{!-- Final message section --}} Have a question you don't see answered above? Our support and sales teams are very happy to help. Shoot us a Message

<TravisLayout @layoutName="layouts/striped" class="tailwind-overrides flush-footer">

  {{!-- Header section --}}
  <UiKit::Box
    @tag='section'
    @margin={{hash top=3 bottom=16 x='auto'}}
    @maxWidth='6xl'
    @padding={{hash x=4}}
    data-test-tvj-page-header-section="true"
  >

    <UiKit::Box  @margin={{hash bottom=5}} @textAlign='center'>
      <UiKit::Text @tag='h1' @variant='h1' data-test-tvj-page-header-title="true">
        Choosing Travis CI vs Jenkins
      </UiKit::Text>
    </UiKit::Box>

    <UiKit::Grid @gap={{4}} as |grid|>
      <grid.item @sm='2/3'>
        <UiKit::Box
          @margin={{hash bottom=10}}
          @maxWidth='2xl'
          @padding={{hash y=4}}
        >
          <UiKit::Text @margin={{hash bottom=3}}>
            Travis CI Enterprise is the continuous integration and delivery platform
            your team knows and loves, on your infrastructure.
          </UiKit::Text>
          <UiKit::Text @margin={{hash bottom=10}}>
            Integrate with Github Enterprise or Github.com to bring flexibility to your CI/CD process.
            Get control over your security and scale out your build infrastructure as needed.
          </UiKit::Text>
          <UiKit::Box @textAlign={{hash base='center' sm='left'}}>
            <UiKit::Button
              @onClick={{action this.toggleContactScroll}}
              data-test-tvj-page-header-button="true"
            >
              Contact the Enterprise Team
            </UiKit::Button>
          </UiKit::Box>
        </UiKit::Box>
      </grid.item>
      <grid.item @sm='1/3'>
        <UiKit::Box
          @margin={{hash x='auto'}}
          @maxWidth={{hash base='2xs' sm='xs'}}
          @padding={{hash sm=(hash y=4)}}
          data-test-tvj-page-header-image="true"
        >
          <SvgImage @name='travis-enterprise' @width='100%'/>
        </UiKit::Box>
      </grid.item>
    </UiKit::Grid>
  </UiKit::Box>

  {{!-- Compare section --}}
  <UiKit::Box
    @tag='section'
    @margin={{hash bottom=16 x='auto'}}
    @maxWidth='6xl'
    @padding={{hash x=4}}
    data-test-tvj-page-compare-section="true"
  >
    <UiKit::Box  @margin={{hash bottom=10}} @textAlign='center'>
      <UiKit::Text @tag='h2' @variant='h2' @color='blue' data-test-tvj-page-compare-title="true">
        Why choose Travis CI over Jenkins?
      </UiKit::Text>
    </UiKit::Box>

    <UiKit::Grid @sm={{2}} @gap={{12}} as |grid|>
      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>01</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Modern user experience</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          With our modern UI and API, your team will get a great
          experience whether they use Travis CI Enterprise with
          their web browser or our command line client.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>02</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Familiarity</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Developers who are experienced with tools such as
          GitHub will have used Travis CI for their open source
          work, making it easier for them to get started and testing
          your team's repositories as well.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>03</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >No maintenance bottleneck</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Maintaining the builds of your repositories should be
          everyone’s job. Instead of relying on that one build person in
          the team, Travis CI makes infrastructure and configuration a
          team responsibility.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>04</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Easy to manage pipelines</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Your time is valuable. Therefore, setting up new pipelines
          is quick and done without the involvement of any other
          team. You can also make changes and improvements as
          your project evolves.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>05</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Consistent environments</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Instead of using the build agent approach, where a
          machine or host is reused between builds, Travis CI
          encourages a 'clean room' approach, where each build is
          run in a new, clean consistent environment.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>06</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Easy to maintain upgrade</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Upgrading to the newest release takes only five minutes.
          Travis CI Enterprise allows your ops/infrastructure team
          to monitor the health of the machines, and easily
          provides diagnostic information to our great support
          team if a problem arises.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

      <grid.item @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-compare-item="true">
        <UiKit::Text @color='grey' @size='sm' @weight='bold'>07</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text
          @borderWidth={{hash bottom='px'}}
          @color='green'
          @display='inline-block'
          @size='2xl'
          @weight='bold'
        >Secret management</UiKit::Text>
        <UiKit::Text>
          Manage secrets easily together with your build
          configuration or through your browser for each
          repository. Travis CI makes sure they are not exposed to
          users and contributors.
        </UiKit::Text>
      </grid.item>

    </UiKit::Grid>
  </UiKit::Box>

  {{!-- Trust section --}}
  <UiKit::Box
    @tag='section'
    @borderWidth={{hash top='xs'}}
    @margin={{hash bottom=24}}
    @padding={{hash top=24}}
    data-test-tvj-page-trust-section="true"
  >
    <UiKit::Box
      @margin={{hash x='auto'}}
      @maxWidth='6xl'
      @padding={{hash x=4}}
    >
      <UiKit::Box  @margin={{hash bottom=10}} @textAlign='center'>
        <UiKit::Text @size='3xl' @weight='bold' data-test-tvj-page-trust-title="true">
          Travis CI is trusted by great companies
        </UiKit::Text>
      </UiKit::Box>

      <UiKit::Grid @align='center' @justify='center' @base={{3}} @md={{5}} as |grid|>
        <grid.item @padding={{hash x=8 bottom=6}} data-test-tvj-page-trust-item="true">
          <SvgImage @name="customer-logos-zendesk" />
        </grid.item>
        <grid.item @padding={{hash x=8 bottom=6}} data-test-tvj-page-trust-item="true">
          <SvgImage @name="customer-logos-engineyard" />
        </grid.item>
        <grid.item @padding={{hash x=8 bottom=6}} data-test-tvj-page-trust-item="true">
          <SvgImage @name="customer-logos-heroku" />
        </grid.item>
        <grid.item @padding={{hash x=8 bottom=6}} data-test-tvj-page-trust-item="true">
          <SvgImage @name="customer-logos-bittorrent" />
        </grid.item>
        <grid.item @padding={{hash x=8 bottom=6}} data-test-tvj-page-trust-item="true">
          <SvgImage @name="customer-logos-moz" />
        </grid.item>
      </UiKit::Grid>
    </UiKit::Box>
  </UiKit::Box>

  {{!-- Contact Section --}}
  {{#if this.scrollToContact}}<ScrollHere />{{/if}}

  <UiKit::Box
    @tag='section'
    @margin={{hash bottom=40 x='auto'}}
    @maxWidth='6xl'
    @padding={{hash x=4}}
    data-test-tvj-page-contact-section="true"
  >
    <UiKit::Grid  @sm={{2}} @align='center' @gap={{4}} @justify='around' as |grid|>
      <grid.item>
        <UiKit::Box
          @maxWidth={{hash base='full' sm='md'}}
          @padding={{hash y=4}}
          @textAlign={{hash base='center' sm='left'}}
        >
          <UiKit::Text
            @tag='h2'
            @leading='xs'
            @margin={{hash bottom=3}}
            @size='5xl'
            @weight='bold'
            data-test-tvj-page-contact-title="true"
          >
            Want to learn more about Travis CI Enterprise?
          </UiKit::Text>
          <UiKit::Text @margin={{hash bottom=4}}>
            Find out how Travis CI Enterprise can benefit your team.
          </UiKit::Text>
          <UiKit::Text>
            Contact our sales team to get a free trial license.
          </UiKit::Text>
        </UiKit::Box>
      </grid.item>
      <grid.item>
        <SalesContactForm
          @referralSource={{this.referralSourceName}}
          @onSuccess={{action this.contactSuccess}}
        />
      </grid.item>
    </UiKit::Grid>
  </UiKit::Box>

  {{!-- Testimonial Section --}}
  <UiKit::Box
    @tag='section'
    @position={{hash type='relative'}}
    data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-section="true"
  >
    <UiKit::Box
      @layer='0'
      @margin={{hash top=-16 left=8}}
      @position={{hash type='absolute' top=0 left=0}}
      @width={{56}}
    >
      <SvgImage @name="blue-waves" />
    </UiKit::Box>

    <UiKit::Box
      @position={{hash type='absolute' top=0 right=0}}
      @margin={{hash top=-16 right=8}}
      @height={{64}}
    >
      <SvgImage @name="grey-blob" @height={{224}} />
    </UiKit::Box>

    <UiKit::Box
      @color='grey-lighter'
      @layer='10'
      @padding={{hash y=10}}
      @position={{hash type='relative'}}
    >
      <UiKit::Box
        @margin={{hash x='auto'}}
        @maxWidth='6xl'
        @padding={{hash x=4}}
      >
        <UiKit::Box @margin={{hash bottom=5}} @textAlign='center'>
          <UiKit::Text @color='blue' @size='5xl' @weight='bold' data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-title="true">
            Learn how enterprises are adopting a microservice
            architecture with Travis CI
          </UiKit::Text>
        </UiKit::Box>


        <UiKit::Grid @base='auto' @wrap='no-wrap' as |grid|>
          <grid.item @padding={{hash top=2 right=6}}>
            <SvgImage @name='kubernetes' @width={{85}} />
          </grid.item>
          <grid.item>
            <UiKit::Text @margin={{hash bottom=6}} @size='2xl' @weight='light' data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-quote="true">
              “It has been a game changer for us because our process to deploy was hours if not
              days before this, we were only building and deploying maybe once a week. We got to
              the point now that we're deploying continuously.”
            </UiKit::Text>
            <UiKit::Text @color='green' @weight='bold' data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-name="true">
              Michael McKay
            </UiKit::Text>
            <UiKit::Text @margin={{hash bottom=10}} data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-position="true">
              DevOps lead, IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service Team
            </UiKit::Text>

            <UiKit::Link @href={{this.caseStudyUrl}} data-test-tvj-page-testimonial-link="true">
              <UiKit::Button @color='blue' @invert={{true}}>
                <UiKit::Grid @display='flex' @align='center'>
                  Read the case study
                  <UiKit::Text @color={{null}} @margin={{hash left=2}} @size='2xl' @weight='bold'>→</UiKit::Text>
                </UiKit::Grid>
              </UiKit::Button>
            </UiKit::Link>
          </grid.item>
        </UiKit::Grid>
      </UiKit::Box>
    </UiKit::Box>
  </UiKit::Box>
</TravisLayout>

<TravisLayout @layoutName="layouts/center" class="tailwind-overrides">
  <SalesContactThanks @backRoute='travisci-vs-jenkins' data-test-tvj-contact-thanks="true" />
</TravisLayout>

<TravisLayout @layoutName="layouts/center">
  <EmailUnsubscribe />
</TravisLayout>
